title.value: A Unified, Scalable Framework for Neural Population Decoding
title.justification: This is the title of the paper being analyzed.
title.quote: A Unified, Scalable Framework for Neural Population Decoding

extractions.description: This paper introduces a scalable framework called POYO for modeling neural population dynamics using large-scale neural recordings. The framework includes a novel tokenization method and a PerceiverIO architecture which enable the integration of multiple neural datasets for robust decoding. Additionally, it discusses the benefits of multi-session training and develops two large-scale pretrained models, POYO-1 and POYO-mp.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments and results which evaluate the proposed framework.
type.quote: In this section, we demonstrate the promise of our approach for large-scale training and examine the benefit of scaling in neural population decoding.

name.justification: The paper is primarily focused on developing a framework for decoding neural population dynamics.
name.quote: Our ability to use deep learning approaches to decipher neural activity would likely benefit from greater scale, in terms of both model size and datasets.

name.justification: The framework makes extensive use of transformer architectures for modeling neural data.
name.quote: The transformer architecture [14], originally introduced in the context of natural language processing (NLP), has shown remarkable flexibility and effectiveness in various domains, especially in the presence of large and diverse datasets.

name.justification: The paper discusses learning latent representations of neural population activity.
name.quote: Utilizing this architecture and training framework, we construct a large-scale multi-session model trained on large datasets from seven nonhuman primates, spanning over 158 different sessions of recording from over 27,373 neural units and over 100 hours of recordings.

name.justification: POYO-1 is one of the large pretrained models introduced in the paper.
name.quote: We build two large pretrained models (POYO-1, POYO-mp) that can be fine-tuned on new sessions and across recordings from different animals and new behavioral tasks.

is_contributed.justification: POYO-1 is introduced and developed as part of this research.

is_executed.quote: We demonstrate that through pretraining on large amounts of data, we can transfer with very few samples (few-shot learning) and thus improve overall brain decoding performance.
